DataElement.preferredName: Vital Signs Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Body Surface Area Less Than Specified Value Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator that specifies whether the Body Surface Area (BSA) is less than the indicated value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vital Signs Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Body Surface Area Less Than Specified Value
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the vital signs domain._A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._Clearly and explicitly stated._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Vital Signs Supplemental Qualifiers Dataset Body Surface Area
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the vital signs domain._A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

Concepts.definition: A dataset containing supplemental information, specifically non-standard variables, to parent records in the vital signs domain.

A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.

Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status._Clearly and explicitly stated._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
